intro: Jacaratia dolichaula, commonly known as the long-stalked jacaratia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Jacaratia dolichaula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
